segments.key_quote: Krishna consciousness is perfect and eternal, and therefore it cannot be lost under any circumstances.
segments.summary: This segment discusses the impediments to devotional service, including Vaishnava Aparadha and the Lord's desire, emphasizing that a devotee advanced in Krishna consciousness cannot be lost.
segments.transcript: who has once absorbed his mind in the glories of the Supreme Personality of Godhead may sometimes be influenced by impediments, but he still does not give up his exalted devotional position. According to Srila Vishwanath Chakravarthy Thakura, there are two kinds of impediments to devotional service. The first is an offense at the lotus feet of a Vaishnava. This is called Vaishnava Aparadha. Shri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu warned His devotees not to commit Vaishnava Aparadha, which He described as the mad elephant offense. When a mad elephant enters a beautiful garden, it destroys everything, leaving a barren field. Similarly, the power of Vaishnava Aparadha is so great that even an advanced devotee becomes almost devoid of his spiritual assets if he commits it. Since Krishna consciousness is eternal, it cannot be destroyed altogether, but advancement may be checked for the time being. Thus, Vaishnava Aparadha is one kind of impediment to devotional service. Sometimes, however, the Supreme Personality of Godhead or His devotee desires to impede one's devotional service. For example, Hiranyakashyapu and Hiranyakshya were formerly Jaya and Vijaya, the gatekeepers in Vaikuntha, but by the desire of the Lord, they became His enemies for three lives. Thus, the desire of the Lord is another kind of impediment. But in both cases, the pure devotee once advanced in Krishna consciousness cannot be lost. Following the orders of his superiors, Swayambhuva and Lord Brahma, Priyavrata accepted family life, but this did not mean he lost his position in devotional service. Krishna consciousness is perfect and eternal, and therefore it cannot be lost under any circumstances. Because the material world is full of obstructions to advancement in Krishna consciousness, there may appear to be many impediments, yet Krishna, the Supreme Personality of Godhead, declares in Bhagavad Gita, 9.31 Once one has taken shelter at the lotus feet of the Lord, he cannot be lost. In this verse, the word Shivatamam is very significant. Shivatamam means the most auspicious. The devotional path is so auspicious that a devotee cannot be lost under any circumstances. This is described in the Srimad Bhagavad Gita by the Lord Himself. Parthnaivehanamutra Vinashastasya Vidyavrata My dear Arjuna, for a devotee, there is no question of being lost, either in this life or in the next. In Bhagavad Gita, 6.43, the Lord clearly explains how this is so. Tatratam buddhi samyogam labhate pavarvadehikam yadate chatato bhuyaha samsiddho kuru nandana By the order of the Lord, a perfect devotee sometimes comes to this material world like an ordinary human being. Because of his previous practice, such a perfect devotee naturally becomes a devotee. He becomes attached to devotional service, apparently without cause. Despite all kinds of impediments due to surrounding circumstances, he automatically perseveres in devotional service and gradually advances until he once again becomes perfect. Below Mangal Thakura had been an advanced devotee in his previous life, but in his next life he became greatly fallen and was attached to a prostitute. Suddenly, however, his entire behavior was changed by the words of the very prostitute, who had so much attracted him, and he became a great devotee. In the lives of exalted devotees, there are many such instances, proving that once one has taken to the shelter of the lotus feet of the Lord, he cannot be lost. Kaunteya pratijanihi namey bhaktav pranashyati The fact is, however, that one becomes a devotee when he is completely freed from all reactions to sinful life. As Krishna states in Bhagavad Gita, 7.28, Esham tuantagatam paapam jananam punyakam te dvandhva moha nirmukta bhajan teman dhrdha vrataah Persons who have acted piously in previous lives and in this life, whose sinful actions are completely eradicated and who are freed from the duality of illusion, engage themselves in my service with determination. On the other hand, as Prahlad Maharaj said, Matirna krishne paratas svatova mito bhipadyeta grihavrataana A person who is too attached to materialistic things, family life, home, family, wife, children and so on, cannot develop Krishna consciousness. These apparent contradictions are resolved in the life of a devotee by the grace of the Supreme Lord and therefore a devotee is never bereft of his position on the path of liberation which is segments.key_quote: The absolute truth is a personality. And what is the meaning of personality? Personality means somebody who has got desires.
segments.summary: This segment explains that the Lord is a personality with desires for enjoyment, which are variegated and multi-dimensional, and that He sometimes arranges for devotees to take on different roles to provide Him with different kinds of pleasure.
segments.transcript: Actually, a conscious person, a very primary characteristic of a conscious person, personality is having desires for enjoyment. That's why ultimately Kama Deva means Krishna. Because Kama, desire to enjoy, ultimately belongs to the Lord. He is the ultimate Kama Deva. So He is the Supreme Personality, means He has desires to enjoy. And enjoyment is not one-sided, it is variegated, it is multi-dimensional. And so, Lord, sometimes everyone is praising me. Okay, let me, somebody should also fight with me. That's another nice thing. So the Lord may decide, okay, my dear two devotees, I will impede your devotional service here. You can do another kind of devotional service by going there and taking birth as Asuras. And I will come and fight. And you should be strong. Don't worry. It is a tough fight. Otherwise, what is the use? I come and fight and then suddenly you surrender. It doesn't please me. So I want you to become powerful demons. Shake the whole universe. Then I will come. Then we will have fight. You see how this is? This is actually, Bhagavatam is establishing the personality. The absolute truth is a personality. And what is the meaning of personality? Personality means somebody who has got desires. And he pursues those desires for enjoyment. And the pursuit of the desire for enjoyment constitutes activities. That is actually the Lord and His associates. That's actually the truth.

segments.key_quote: The greater reality and the dominant reality is the spiritual world. The material world is a small portion.
segments.summary: This segment uses the analogy of a prisoner's perspective to explain how our understanding of the spiritual world is limited by our material existence, emphasizing that the spiritual world is the greater and dominant reality.
segments.transcript: What happens is, our view of the world and the creation, it is just like the prisoner's view in a prison in our world. The prisoner is in the prison. He is used to things in the prison. Big walls. He is conditioned. He cannot escape. He cannot relate with the family members. It's all restricted. He wants to enjoy. It's all restricted. So this is actually the perspective of a prisoner. In the same way, our perspective is actually we see from the material world. Actually the truth is, we all know, we all are outside the prison in this world. So we know that how the world is full of irrigatedness. So many activities. There are parks. There are malls. There are restaurants. So many ways to enjoy. By the way, there is one small portion in our city, in every city, called the prison. In the same way, the reality is, the greater reality is, the Lord and His associates and the wonderful pastimes that happen in the spiritual domain. By the way, there is one part of the creation called the material world where all the rebellious living entities are put there. So, this is actually the reality. But, because we are in the material world, we are trying to understand the spiritual reality from the material domain. It's just like the prisoners looking at, oh, there is something called a free world, is it? Oh, there is some park. There are parks there. There are all such beautiful things. Okay, maybe there. So, that's the view of an inmate of a prison. Actually, that's the way we look at when we hear about the spiritual world. But, the greater reality and the dominant reality is the spiritual world.

segments.key_quote: One will not lose his devotional position if one is under the order of superiors one is acting in this way.
segments.summary: This segment discusses how the Lord's desires and the orders of superiors can lead devotees to take on different roles, using the examples of Jaya and Vijaya and Priyavrata, emphasizing that following the orders of superiors ensures one does not lose their spiritual position.
segments.transcript: The material world is a small portion. So, so this is the, so these are the reasons why certain times the Lord wants, Lord is a personality and He has got desires and He wants to pursue those desires for His pleasure and His own devotees take up different roles to give Him different varieties of pleasure and that is another example. So, this is an example Prabhupada has quoted of Jaya and Vijaya where their devotional service was in one sense impeded but actually not in another sense. It was meant for a larger, another kind of a pleasure of the Lord. So, sometimes we may see this kind of an impediment. Another one is Priyavrata himself. Priyavrata was not, his impediment came not from the Lord but from his devotee. Swayambhuva Manu and Brahma, both great personalities, great devotees, they went and told Priyavrata who was in his, like it is described here, Makaranda Rasa, Aveshita Cheta Saha, he was absorbed in transcendental mellows of the Lord but they went and told him, no, no, now you come, become a king, become a householder, have queens, have children, all of that. So, he may do that but Priyavrata when he is doing that, he never lost his shivatamam padaveena prayena hinvanti. They never lose their spiritual position. That is to be appreciated and understood because Krishna consciousness is perfect and it is eternal and it cannot be lost under any circumstance. So here, important point is following the orders of his superiors Swayambhuva Manu and Lord Brahma, Priyavrata accepted family life but this did not mean he lost his position in devotional service. This is the point that this chapter is going to point out. Bhakti is such that if one is in different kinds of roles, if one is in different kinds of situations, but those roles and situations are under the order of the superiors, then one will not lose his devotional position. This is the crux of the matter. shivatamam padaveena prayena hinvanti One will not lose his devotional position if one is under the order of superiors one is acting in this way.
